Welcome to empyric’s documentation!¶

class empyric.experiment.Alarm(variable, condition, protocol=None)¶

Monitors a variable, triggers if a condition is met and indicates the response protocol

class empyric.experiment.Clock¶

Clock for keeping time in an experiment; works like a standard stopwatch

class empyric.experiment.Experiment(variables, routines=None)¶

An iterable class which represents an experiment; iterates through any assigned routines, and retrieves and stores the values of all experiment variables.

class empyric.experiment.Hold(variables=None, values=None, start=0, end=inf)¶

Holds a fixed value

update(state)¶

Updates the controlled variables and returns the new substate; overwritten by child classes

Parameters

state – (dict/Series) state of the calling experiment or process in the form, {…, variable: value, …}

Returns

(dict/Series) substate with the updated values of the controlled variables

class empyric.experiment.Variable(instrument=None, knob=None, meter=None, expression=None, definitions=None)¶

Basic representation of an experimental variable; comes in 3 kinds: knob, meter and expression. Knobs can be set, meters can be measured and expressions can be calculated.

A knob is a variable that can be directly controlled by an instrument, e.g. the voltage of a power supply.

A meter is a variable that is measured by an instrument, such as temperature. Some meters can be controlled directly or indirectly through an associated (but distinct) knob.

An expression is a variable that is not directly measured, but is calculated based on other variables of the experiment. An example of an expression is the output power of a power supply, where voltage is a knob and current is a meter: power = voltage * current.

empyric.experiment.build_experiment(runcard, settings=None, instruments=None, alarms=None)¶

Build an Experiment object based on a runcard, in the form of a .yaml file or a dictionary

Parameters

  • runcard – (dict/str) description of the experiment in the runcard format; can be a path

  • settings – (dict) dictionary of settings to be populated

  • instruments – (dict) dictionary instruments to be populated

  • alarms – (dict) dictionary of alarms to be populated

Returns

(Experiment) the experiment described by the runcard

empyric.experiment.convert_time(time_value)¶

If time_value is a string, converts a time of the form “number units” (e.g. “3.5 hours”) to the time in seconds. If time_value is a number, just returns the same number If time_value is an array, it iterates through the array doing either of the previous two operations on every element.

Parameters

time_value – (str/float) time value, possibly including units such as ‘hours’

Returns

(int) time in seconds

class empyric.adapters.Adapter(instrument, **kwargs)¶

Adapters connect instruments defined in an experiment to the appropriate communication backends.

query(*args, validator=None, **kwargs)¶
Parameters

  • self – (Adapter) the adapter object whose method is being wrapped

  • args – any arguments to the method to be wrapped

  • validator – (callable) function that returns True if its input looks right or False if it does not

  • kwargs – any keyword arguments for the method to be wrapped

Returns

(str/float/int/bool) instrument response, if valid

read(*args, validator=None, **kwargs)¶
Parameters

  • self – (Adapter) the adapter object whose method is being wrapped

  • args – any arguments to the method to be wrapped

  • validator – (callable) function that returns True if its input looks right or False if it does not

  • kwargs – any keyword arguments for the method to be wrapped

Returns

(str/float/int/bool) instrument response, if valid

empyric.adapters.chaperone(method)¶

Wraps all read and query methods of adapters; monitors and handles communication issues

Parameters

method – (callable) method to be wrapped

Returns

(callable) wrapped method
